alert.note: Alert for Northern Panhandle (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 10 at 12:42PM MST until March 11 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations between 1 and 4 inches in the valleys and 3 to 7 inches in the mountains. * WHERE...Metaline, Orin-Rice Road, Priest River, Deer Park, Ione, Schweitzer Mountain Road, Chewelah, Flowery Trail Road, Bonners Ferry, Northport, Springdale-Hunters Road, Clark Fork, Newport, Sandpoint, Metaline Falls, Fruitland, Athol, Colville, Tiger, Eastport, and Kettle Falls. * WHEN...Until 4 AM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Travel conditions will improve late in the morning and early in the afternoon as temperatures climb into the mid and upper 30s. However, snow showers late in the day into the evening may produce additional localized accumulations late in the day and into the evening.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
